# Recipe: Stovetop Butter Chicken

## Table of Contents
- [Introduction](#introduction)
- [Ingredients](#ingredients)
- [Equipment](#equipment)
- [Preparation Time](#preparation-time)
- [Cooking Time](#cooking-time)
- [Steps](#steps)
- [Serving Suggestions](#serving-suggestions)
- [Variations](#variations)
- [Tips and Tricks](#tips-and-tricks)
- [Nutritional Information](#nutritional-information)
- [Storage and Leftovers](#storage-and-leftovers)
- [Frequently Asked Questions](#frequently-asked-questions)

## Introduction
Stovetop Butter Chicken is a popular Indian dish known for its creamy and flavorful sauce. It originated in the Punjab region of India and has gained popularity worldwide. This recipe combines tender chicken pieces with a rich tomato-based sauce, infused with aromatic spices and finished with a touch of butter. It is traditionally served with naan bread or steamed rice.

## Ingredients
- 500g boneless, skinless chicken thighs, cut into bite-sized pieces
- 1 cup plain yogurt
- 3 tablespoons butter
- 1 large onion, finely chopped
- 4 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 tablespoon ginger, grated
- 2 teaspoons garam masala
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1 teaspoon ground coriander
- 1 teaspoon turmeric
- 1 teaspoon paprika
- 1/2 teaspoon chili powder (adjust to taste)
- 1 can (400g) crushed tomatoes
- 1/2 cup heavy cream
- Salt, to taste
- Fresh cilantro, for garnish

## Equipment
- Large skillet or frying pan
- Mixing bowls
- Cutting board
- Knife
- Wooden spoon or spatula

## Preparation Time
- Marinating the chicken: 1 hour

## Cooking Time
- Total: 40 minutes
- Preparation: 10 minutes
- Cooking: 30 minutes

## Steps
1. In a mixing bowl, combine the chicken pieces and yogurt. Mix well to coat the chicken evenly. Cover and marinate in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour, or overnight for best results.
2. Heat 2 tablespoons of butter in a large skillet or frying pan over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and cook until it becomes soft and translucent, about 5 minutes.
3. Add the minced garlic and grated ginger to the pan. Cook for an additional 2 minutes, stirring frequently to prevent burning.
4. In a small bowl, mix together the garam masala, ground cumin, ground coriander, turmeric, paprika, and chili powder. Add this spice mixture to the pan and cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly to toast the spices.
5. Add the marinated chicken to the pan, along with any excess yogurt marinade. Cook for 5-7 minutes, or until the chicken is browned on all sides.
6. Pour in the crushed tomatoes and stir well to combine. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 15-20 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce has thickened.
7. Stir in the heavy cream and remaining tablespoon of butter. Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, until the sauce is creamy and well combined. Season with salt to taste.
8. Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve hot with naan bread or steamed rice.

## Serving Suggestions
- Stovetop Butter Chicken is traditionally served with naan bread or steamed rice.
- You can also serve it with roti, paratha, or even plain bread.
- Accompany the dish with a side of cucumber raita or a fresh salad for a refreshing contrast.

## Variations
- For a vegetarian version, substitute the chicken with paneer (Indian cottage cheese) or tofu.
- For a healthier alternative, use boneless, skinless chicken breast instead of chicken thighs.
- Adjust the level of spiciness by increasing or decreasing the amount of chili powder used.
- Add vegetables like bell peppers, peas, or mushrooms for added texture and flavor.

## Tips and Tricks
- For a richer flavor, marinate the chicken overnight in the yogurt and spices.
- Use a skillet or frying pan with a thick bottom to prevent the sauce from burning.
- If the sauce becomes too thick, add a splash of water or chicken broth to thin it out.
- To make the dish spicier, add a chopped green chili or a pinch of cayenne pepper.
- For a creamier sauce, add a tablespoon of cashew paste or ground almonds.

## Nutritional Information
- The nutritional information provided is approximate and may vary depending on the specific ingredients used.
- Calories: 400 per serving
- Fat: 25g
- Protein: 30g
- Carbohydrates: 15g
- Fiber: 3g

## Storage and Leftovers
- Stovetop Butter Chicken can be stored in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.
- Reheat in a skillet or microwave until heated through.
- The sauce may thicken when stored, so add a splash of water or cream when reheating to restore the desired consistency.

## Frequently Asked Questions
- Q: Can I use chicken breast instead of chicken thighs?
  - A: Yes, you can use boneless, skinless chicken breast instead of chicken thighs. However, chicken thighs tend to be more flavorful and tender in this recipe.
- Q: Can I make this dish ahead of time?
  - A: Yes, you can prepare the sauce ahead of time and refrigerate it. Cook the chicken and combine it with the sauce when ready to serve.
- Q: Can I freeze Stovetop Butter Chicken?
  - A: Yes, you can freeze Stovetop Butter Chicken for up to 3 months. Thaw it in the refrigerator overnight before reheating.
- Q: Can I make this dish vegan?
  - A: To make a vegan version, substitute the chicken with tofu or vegetables and use plant-based yogurt and cream alternatives.
